alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following counties, Bennington and Windham. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arlington, Londonderry, Manchester, Manchester Center, Peru, Glastenbury, Stratton Mountain, Stratton Valley, Bondville, Intervale, Piper Ridge, Stratton Acres, Strattonwald, Bromley Village, Stocker Acres, Barnumville, Manchester Depot, French Hollow, Richville and Peru Town Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
